channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: An XML representation of a search request

item.title: [HIVE-2651] The variable hive.exec.mode.local.auto.tasks.max should be changed
item.description:
It should be called hive.exec.mode.local.auto.input.files.max instead.
The number of input files are checked currently.
item.summary: The variable hive.exec.mode.local.auto.tasks.max should be changed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

This issue is closed now. It was released with the fix in 0.9.0. If there is a problem, please open a new jira and link this one with that.

Doc note: The old variable, hive.exec.mode.local.auto.tasks.max, is available in the wiki here:

  • Configuration Properties - hive.exec.mode.local.auto.tasks.max

The new variable, hive.exec.mode.local.auto.input.files.max, is available in the wiki here:

  • Configuration Properties - hive.exec.mode.local.auto.input.files.max

item.title: [HIVE-2652] Change arc config to hide generated files from Differential by default
item.description: I noticed that some files are hidden by default in arc-jira-lib, e.g. events/_init_.php. Is it possible via project-specific configuration to do the same for Thrift-generated files in Hive, e.g. metastore/src/gen*, service/src/gen*, serde/src/gen*?
item.summary: Change arc config to hide generated files from Differential by default

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: This would make reviewing diffs which make Thrift idl changes much more pleasant.
Fixed generically for thrift in arc-jira.
This issue is closed now. It was released with the fix in 0.9.0. If there is a problem, please open a new jira and link this one with that.

item.title: [HIVE-2653] ptest overwrite should cover all .out files (not just clientpositive/negative)
item.description:
This would make it more useful for mass update.

Currently missing:

  • TestContribCliDriver
  • TestContribNegativeCliDriver
  • TestMTQueries
  • TestHBaseMiniMRCliDriver
  • TestHBaseCliDriver
  • TestParse
  • TestMinimrCliDriver
  • TestNegativeMinimrCliDriver
item.summary: ptest overwrite should cover all .out files (not just clientpositive/negative)

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

item.title: [HIVE-2654] "hive.querylog.location" requires parent directory to be exist or else folder creation fails
item.description: if value of "hive.querylog.location" is '/tmp/root/hive123/test' if the parent directories not exist the creation of the folder is failed.
item.environment: Hadoop 0.20.1, Hive0.9.0 and SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 10 SP2 (i586) - Kernel 2.6.16.60-0.21-smp (5).
item.summary: "hive.querylog.location" requires parent directory to be exist or else folder creation fails

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Patch uploaded in Phabricator.
https://reviews.facebook.net/D855
For creating directory mkdir() api is used in HiveHistory() that changed to mkdirs()..

item.title: [HIVE-2655] Ability to define functions in HQL
item.description:
Ability to create functions in HQL as a substitute for creating them in Java.

Jonathan Chang requested I create this issue.
item.summary: Ability to define functions in HQL

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

REVISION DETAIL
https://reviews.facebook.net/D915

cwsteinbach has requested changes to the revision "HIVE-2655 [jira] Ability to define functions in HQL".

INLINE COMMENTS
ql/src/test/queries/clientpositive/macro.q:3 The test coverage for this feature needs to be expanded.

What happens if the macro references a hiveconf or hivevar parameter?

Missing positive coverage for:

  • Macro with zero input parameters
  • Macro with two input parameters
  • EXPLAIN output for a query using each variation of the above.
  • EXPLAIN EXTENDED output for a query using each variation of the above.

Negative coverage for:

  • macro body references an undefined input parameter
  • input parameter not referenced in macro body
  • macro that defines two input parameters with the same name
  • Defining the same macro twice.
  • Droping a macro that doesn't exist.

REVISION DETAIL
https://reviews.facebook.net/D915

BRANCH
macro

cwsteinbach has commented on the revision "HIVE-2655 [jira] Ability to define functions in HQL".

INLINE COMMENTS
ql/src/test/queries/clientpositive/macro.q:3 A couple more:

  • Reference the same macro twice in the same query
  • Reference two different macros in the same query

REVISION DETAIL
https://reviews.facebook.net/D915

BRANCH
macro

Jonathan,

I haven't seen any updates to this JIRA in a while. Are you still working on it? If not, would you mind if I took it forward?

Brock
Yeah, I haven't had a chance to work on this. Looks like all that needs to be done at this point is unittests. I would be more than happy to have you take this the rest of the way!

Hi,

OK great! Yes the patch required only minor rebasing. I'll work on the unit tests and then post the resulting patch here.

Thanks!
Brock

brock has commented on the revision "HIVE-2655 [jira] Ability to define functions in HQL".

Regarding

  • Defining the same macro twice.
  • Dropping a macro that doesn't exist.

I assume the behavior should be the same as functions with allows both of these behaviors. As such I wonder why they were listed under negative tests?

REVISION DETAIL
https://reviews.facebook.net/D915

BRANCH
macro

ARCANIST PROJECT
hive

To: JIRA, jsichi, cwsteinbach, jonchang
Cc: jonchang, ikabiljo, brock
Can you add more tests ?

Namit,

Thanks for moving this to "Open". I should have noticed that. I took this patch over from Jonathan and have added a bunch of tests, error messages, and a little functionality. I will have a new patch posted in a day or two.

Cheers!
Brock
Marking as "Patch Available" since this is ready for a review.
@Brock: Can you open a new phabricator review request for your updated version of the patch? Thanks.
Carl Steinbach I did here https://reviews.facebook.net/D8673 and setup as a weblink not sure why it's not updating the JIRA automatically.
Ping
+1. Sorry for the delay. Patch does not apply clean now. Please rebase and I will commit.

Sorry for the slow response. I have attached the rebased patch here and on https://reviews.facebook.net/D8673.

FWIW, I ran the unit test suite and they all passed.
Actually that latest patch is bad. Regenerating.
OK here is the correct patch, the previous one had the .orig files from the --merge.
Patch is clean. Running tests now.
+1 Committed to trunk. Thanks Brock and Jonathon! Really cool.
Nice! Thank you Edward and Jonathon!

Can you think of any reason why nonreserved_keywords_input37.q is failing?

CREATE TABLE table(string string) STORED AS TEXTFILE;

LOAD DATA LOCAL INPATH '../data/files/docurl.txt' INTO TABLE table;

SELECT table, count(1)
FROM
(
FROM table
SELECT TRANSFORM (table.string)
USING 'java -cp ../build/ql/test/classes org.apache.hadoop.hive.scripts.extracturl' AS (table, count)
) subq
GROUP BY table;
{

Hi,

I wonder if it's an environmental issue? I cannot reproduce with the following command:

ant clean package && ant test -Dtestcase=TestCliDriver -Dqfile=nonreserved_keywords_input37.q
Marking resolved as this was committed in 54ec1cb0d0540edf7946738bc113e90adcc09a6d.
This issue has been fixed and released as part of 0.12 release. If you find further issues, please create a new jira and link it to this one.

Hi,
I am no longer reachable at this address. Please contact me at either slycoder@gmail.com or (310)425-3759.

Cheers,
Jonathan

Doc note: This needs to be documented in the DDL wikidoc.

  • Language Manual – DDL

Thanks go to Elliot West for requesting this on the Hive user mailing list.

  • user@hive "Hive Macros roadmap" Sept. 11, 2015

Marking resolved as this was committed in 54ec1cb0d0540edf7946738bc113e90adcc09a6d.

  • Language Manual - DDL - Create/Drop Macro

Review questions for Brock Noland:

  1. Does hive.exec.drop.ignorenonexistent apply to macros?
  2. Can CREATE MACRO specify db_name.macro_name?
Removed the TODOC12 label.

item.title: [HIVE-2656] Add a command line flag to specify a jar whence to load UDFs
item.description: To extend the functionality of Hive, it is useful to be able to easily deploy packages of UDFs and register the functions therein. Right now it is a bit cumbersome to do ADD JAR and CREATE TEMPORARY FUNCTION. This can be greatly simplified by adding a simple command line flag that will leverage the code in HIVE-2523 to load all the functions.
item.summary: Add a command line flag to specify a jar whence to load UDFs

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.

comments.comment: Note that the jar needs to have been produced via Hive's PDK in order to have the necessary metadata in the manifest.

jonchang requested code review of "HIVE-2656 [jira] Add a command line flag to specify a jar whence to load UDFs".
Reviewers: JIRA

HIVE-2656

To extend the functionality of Hive, it is useful to be able to easily deploy packages of UDFs and register the functions therein. Right now it is a bit cumbersome to do ADD JAR and CREATE TEMPORARY FUNCTION. This can be greatly simplified by adding a simple command line flag that will leverage the code in <a href="https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HIVE-2523" title="add a new builtins subproject"><del>HIVE-2523</del></a> to load all the functions.

item.title: [HIVE-2658] add a option in hive to skip corrupted data entirely
item.description:
Add a new parameter:

hive.skip.corrupted.data

This is independent of the type of the underlying data.

The idea is as follows:

We have some corrupted data in our cluster right now.
We will run hive over all the corrupted partitions:

use bucketizedhiveinputformat
set hive.skip.corrupted.data=true

insert overwrite table <T> partition <P>
select * from <T> where <P>

This way, <T>@<P> will be regenerated with all the data that can be read.

If HiveRecordReader gets a exception getting the next row, the mapper will behave as if no more data is present in the file.
item.summary: add a option in hive to skip corrupted data entirely

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Not needed - it will be difficult to come up with a generic
exception.

item.title: [HIVE-2659] SHOW FUNCTIONS still returns internal operators
item.summary: SHOW FUNCTIONS still returns internal operators

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment:
HIVE-1892 implemented a mechanism that filters the output of the SHOW FUNCTIONS
command in order to remove type operators, e.g. DOUBLE, BOOLEAN, etc.
However, we're still not removing other "non-function" functions such as '+',
'&', 'if', 'in', etc. Instead of filtering the output of SHOW FUNCTIONS,
I think a better approach is to add registerInternalUDF and registerInternalGenericUDF
methods to FunctionRegistry, and then use the information captured by these
methods to influence the generation of the list of functions returned to SHOW FUNCTIONS.

Overall: -1 no tests executed

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12508389/HIVE-2659.patch

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HIVE-Build/112/testReport
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HIVE-Build/112/console

Messages:

Executing org.apache.hive.ptest.execution.CleanupPhase
Executing org.apache.hive.ptest.execution.PrepPhase
Tests failed with: NonZeroExitCodeException: Command 'bash /data/hive-ptest/working/scratch/source-prep.sh' failed with exit status 1 and output '+ [[ -n '' ]]
+ export 'ANT_OPTS=-Xmx1g -XX:MaxPermSize=256m -Dhttp.proxyHost=localhost -Dhttp.proxyPort=3128'
+ ANT_OPTS='-Xmx1g -XX:MaxPermSize=256m -Dhttp.proxyHost=localhost -Dhttp.proxyPort=3128'

item.title: [HIVE-2660] Need better exception handling in RCFile tolerate corruptions mode
item.description:
The exception handling in nextKeyValueTolerateCorruptions treats IOException as follows:

  • if EOFException, corrupt, can be tolerated
  • If CheckSumException, corrupt, can be tolerated
  • else not a corruption, re-throw

But the compression code can also throw IOException in case of corruption, which will get re-thrown in this case.

The correct way of handling IOException is:

  • if BlockMissingException, re-throw.
  • if not BlockMissingException -> corruption, can be tolerated
item.summary: Need better exception handling in RCFile tolerate corruptions mode

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

item.title: [HIVE-2661] ErrorCode and SQLStates list
item.description:
If there is the errorCode and SQLStates list, I think that many developers are more happy.

example:
http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.0/en/connector-j-reference-error-sqlstates.html

But now errorCode is hard coded in the following example.

Driver.java

    } catch (SemanticException e) {
      errorMessage = "FAILED: Error in semantic analysis: " + e.getMessage();
      SQLState = ErrorMsg.findSQLState(e.getMessage());
      console.printError(errorMessage, "\n"
          + org.apache.hadoop.util.StringUtils.stringifyException(e));
      return (10);
    } catch (ParseException e) {
      errorMessage = "FAILED: Parse Error: " + e.getMessage();
      SQLState = ErrorMsg.findSQLState(e.getMessage());
      console.printError(errorMessage, "\n"
          + org.apache.hadoop.util.StringUtils.stringifyException(e));
      return (11);
    } catch (Exception e) {
      errorMessage = "FAILED: Hive Internal Error: " + Utilities.getNameMessage(e);
      SQLState = ErrorMsg.findSQLState(e.getMessage());
      console.printError(errorMessage + "\n"
          + org.apache.hadoop.util.StringUtils.stringifyException(e));
      return (12);
    } finally {
      perfLogger.PerfLogEnd(LOG, PerfLogger.COMPILE);
      restoreSession(queryState);
    }

So, for example, automatic generation of the following table is difficult.

errorCode error message SQLState
10 FAILED: Error in semantic analysis 42S02
11 FAILED: Parse Error 42000

So, I think that refactoring to unify management of　errorCode and SQLStates using enum or constant class is good.

I am glad when it is inquired.

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment:
Error Codes & Messages are organaized in https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HIVE-3001

It's fine!

but, there is unprocessed code.

for example,

Driver.java

      // TODO: do better with handling types of Exception here
      errorMessage = "FAILED: Hive Internal Error: " + Utilities.getNameMessage(e);
      SQLState = "08S01";
      console.printError(errorMessage + "\n"
          + org.apache.hadoop.util.StringUtils.stringifyException(e));
      return (12);
    } finally {

And, SQLState "08S01" is hard coded.

for example,
HiveConnection.java

  public HiveConnection(HiveConf hiveConf) throws SQLException {
    try {
      client = new HiveServer.HiveServerHandler(hiveConf);
    } catch (MetaException e) {
      throw new SQLException("Error accessing Hive metastore: "
          + e.getMessage(), "08S01",e);
    }
    isClosed = false;
    configureConnection();
  }

I'm glad if this is processed.

Thanks.

item.title: [HIVE-2663] DynamicSerDeTypeList.serialize() method have null check for the "nullProtocol" it needs to be change.
item.description:
In DynamicSerDeTypeList.serialize() method have the null check for the "nullProtocol" like

if (element == null && nullProtocol != null) {

here if element= null and nullProtocol=null in this case it will execute else block with element=null.
item.environment: Hadoop 0.20.1, Hive0.9.0 and SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 10 SP2 (i586) - Kernel 2.6.16.60-0.21-smp (5).
item.summary: DynamicSerDeTypeList.serialize() method have null check for the "nullProtocol" it needs to be change.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
In the below case nulll check is not needed and this will make the code complicated and looks bugy like

if (element == null && nullProtocol != null) {

here if element = null and nullProtocol = null the else block will be executed with element = null.

So we can remove the check nullProtocol != null.
Please open new jira, still it is a problem on master.
